item.title: Surgeon Uses PlayStation Controller in Medical Procedure
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Surgeon completed procedure using PlayStation Move controller.
  • Potential for remote robotic surgery could save lives.
  • Technology has impressive potential for improving surgical procedures.

A surgeon has used a Sony PlayStation controller to perform a surgical procedure. The impressive feat combines a delicate procedure with a widely accessible PlayStation controller, and has the potential to change the future of surgery.

While the vast majority of game controllers get used for their intended purpose, sometimes controllers are used for things other than gaming. One famous example of this is the game controller that was used to pilot the ill-fated Titan submarine. While that historical moment ended in tragedy, this use of a gaming controller could someday save lives.

A surgeon in Switzerland has officially completed an endoscopic procedure using a PlayStation Move controller. According to the report, the procedure was performed on a pig located in Hong Kong, with 5,780 miles between the surgeon and the subject. The endoscopy was performed utilizing a robotic surgical system that can be controlled remotely which was connected to a direct WebSocket protocol for real-time data transfer. The surgeon did everything while watching a video feed and using the PlayStation Move controller to control the robot's actions, all while maintaining a latency of 300 milliseconds or less.

Prior Attempts Used a Different PlayStation Controller

Although the PlayStation Move controller was used for this particular procedure, the PlayStation 5 DualSense controller has been utilized in prior attempts. It's not clear if the surgeon prefers one over the other. It's possible that the handling of the PlayStation Move controller may be more similar to what a surgeon would normally use to control one of these robotic surgical devices, and may feel more comfortable or natural for them.

The potential for this technology is impressive. Many endoscopic and surgical procedures in general are already performed with the assistance of robotic devices, which allows extreme precision. In some cases, these robotic methods allow surgeons to perform procedures with smaller incisions and far less trauma to the body, improving recovery time and reducing the risk of complications. The hope is that this existing technology could be done remotely, allowing surgeons to perform both life-saving procedures and routine ones without being physically located near the patient. This could allow doctors to save lives in places where on-site medical personnel are limited, or there's no one available with particular expertise.

Getting to the point where remote surgical procedures could take a while, as maintaining an excellent internet connection is an absolute necessity. However, the fact that the technology is already working well and that the delicate and precise movements can be controlled by something as accessible and relatively affordable as a PlayStation controller is genuinely impressive.

item.title: CoD MW3 and Warzone: How to Unlock Sam Operator
item.description:
Collaborations in Call of Duty have exploded throughout the Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 cycle. Activision's shooter series has joined forces with a wide variety of franchises ranging from Halloween's Michael Myers to Terrifier's Art the Clown and the crossovers keep on coming as part of the Season 6 update.

Although the Modern Warfare 3 cycle is coming to a close, Sledgehammer Games continues to give players even more content to get their hands on before the attention turns to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . Here, find out how to unlock the Sam Operator and a wealth of other themed items.

How To Unlock Sam Operator

Like most crossover bundles in Call of Duty , unlocking the Sam Operator involves spending some CoD Points instead of completing specific tasks across multiplayer, zombies, and the battle royale. To add the Sam Operator to the ever-expanding collection, head to the in-game store and spend 2400 CoD Points .

Once purchased, players can select Sam through the Operator tab at the top of the main menu along with the option to select him for use in Modern Warfare 3 or Warzone or both.

Sam Operator Bundle Items

In addition to the Sam Operator skin, the Trick 'r Treat bundle contains plenty of other items for players to customize their loadouts and in-game appearance with. Take a look at the full list below:

  • Sam Operator
  • Sam Unmasked Operator skin
  • Sweet Tooth weapon blueprint
  • Season's Greetings weapon blueprint
  • Sam's Lollipop weapon blueprint
  • Lollipopped finishing move
  • His Night, His Rules emblem
  • Boo! Weapon charm
  • Trick 'r Treat - Sam loading screen

Who Is Sam?

Created by director and writer Michael Dougherty, Sam is a character that appeared in Doughterty's Season's Greetings short film that was released in 1996. The character then featured as one of the main protagonists 2007's Trick 'r Treat film. Trick 'r Treat is one of several in-game events taking place as part of The Haunting, Call of Duty 's annual Halloween event. Sam is expected to be one of the final crossover skins in the Modern Warfare 3 cycle. Unfortunately, the skin will not carry over to Black Ops 6 multiplayer but players will still have access to them when dropping into Warzone matches.

Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 continued the trends of crossover skins and other franchises from the world of entertainment entering its universe. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is likely to continue the collaborations as players look to play as their favorite characters from various franchises.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Fan Designs NieR: Automata Skin Concept for Kiriko
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Kiriko in Overwatch 2 is a popular and powerful support hero with impressive skills and mobility.
  • A fan created a skin concept transforming Kiriko into NieR: Automata's 2B.
  • The crossover skin idea has gained approval in the game's community.

An Overwatch 2 fan has created a skin concept that transforms Kiriko into NieR: Automata 's 2B, with impressive results. Kiriko was one of the first new characters added to Overwatch 2 and has since become one of the game's most popular heroes for reasons such as her competitive potential.

Kiriko is one of the notable names when players debate about Overwatch 2 's best support heroes. With her skills kit, she can heal and protect allies, deal damage, and have considerable mobility on the battlefield. Because of this, Kiriko has been a highlight in the game's meta and a hot pick for players who want to stand out. Recently, a talented fan decided to give the support a different twist by transforming her into a character from another popular franchise.

On Twitter, a user called aixo_official created an impressive skin concept that turns Kiriko into 2B from Nier: Automata . The artist shows Kiriko with the same short white hair and a black blindfold that covers the eyes of the protagonist of PlatinumGames' JRPG. The Overwatch 2 hero wears the same high-slit turtleneck dress and thigh-high black leather boots, and her abilities have got a visual makeover. Healing Ofuda's talisman is stamped with the logo of YoRHa, the military force that created the android, while Protection Suzu has the form of a Black Box, which is the “heart” of YoRHa androids. The Kunai has been given the same design as the Virtuous Contract, one of the swords used by 2B.

Neat Overwatch 2 Skin Concept Dresses Kiriko as 2B

While the Nier franchise has a variety of android characters and YoRHa creations, 2B stands out as one of the most popular names among fans. Created to battle the machines that have invaded the planet in the name of humans, 2B is known for her striking and controversial appearance, and for being one of the central characters in the highly praised Nier: Automata . The character is also remembered for using the swords Virtuous Contract and Virtuous Treaty, and for her appearances in games such as Soul Calibur 6 , Final Fantasy 14 , and Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising .

The skin concept shared by the artist has impressed the Blizzard shooter community, with some players commenting that if this skin became real, it would have a sales potential “capable of financing Overwatch 3 .” After all, Kiriko is one of the game's heroes who frequently receives cosmetics, recent examples being the Legendary Oni skin, and the one part of the Overwatch 2 x My Hero Academia collaboration.

item.title: Roblox: RIVALS Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All RIVALS Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for RIVALS
  • How to Get More RIVALS Codes

RIVALS is a popular Roblox game in which players can take part in both solo and team duels. Whether they're going 1v1 against a stranger or 5v5 alongside a group of friends, the experience provided is highly enjoyable, making this one of the best fighting games on Roblox .

By completing duels, players can earn keys, which can be used to unlock new weapons and skins. Roblox players can also get keys by redeeming RIVALS codes, which can be incredibly useful when they're first starting out. Codes also provide other types of in-game rewards, including charms, skins, and weapons.

Updated October 4, 2024, by Tom Bowen: Update 5 of RIVALS is finally here, and with it comes new game modes, finishers, and balance changes. Players can also redeem two new RIVALS codes to get themselves a couple of free community wraps. After doing so, they should take a moment to bookmark this page and then check back here often, as new codes for RIVALS are added to the list below on a fairly regular basis.

All RIVALS Codes

Working RIVALS Codes

  • COMMUNITY7 - Redeem for a free Community Wrap (NEW)
  • COMMUNITY6 - Redeem for a free Community Wrap (NEW)
  • COMMUNITY5 - Redeem for a free Community Wrap
  • 100MVISITS - Redeem for a 100 Million Visits Charm
  • SORRY - Redeem for x10 Keys + x1 Wrap Box 2
  • COMMUNITY4 - Redeem for a free Community Wrap
  • COMMUNITY3 - Redeem for a free Community Wrap
  • COMMUNITY2 - Redeem for a free Community Wrap
  • COMMUNITY - Redeem for a free Community Wrap
  • BONUS - Redeem for a free Key

Expired RIVALS Codes

  • RELEASE - Redeem for a Day One Charm

How to Redeem Codes for RIVALS

The process for redeeming codes in RIVALS is a little different than it is in other Roblox games. This is because players will first need to follow the developers (@Sensei_RBX and @NosniyRBLX) on Twitter before the option to redeem codes becomes available. Thankfully, for those who don't have a Twitter account, it's possible to use the Twitter handle of an account that's already following both devs, which can make the process a lot easier. For those having trouble, though, the following step-by-step instructions should help.

  1. Launch Rivals and press the Rewards button with the picture of a gift from the bottom of the screen.
  2. Scroll down to the bottom of the Rewards menu and look for a box that says "Follow the developers to redeem codes".
  3. Type in the Twitter handle of an account that is following @Sensei_RBX and @NosniyRBLX and then press the green Verify button.
  4. Once the account has been verified, the text on the green button should change to Redeem.
  5. Type one of the RIVALS codes from the list above into the box and then press Redeem.

How to Get More RIVALS Codes

The best way to get more RIVALS codes is to bookmark this page and check back here as often as possible, as we're constantly on the lookout for new Roblox codes and will update this guide whenever we find more. Alternatively, players can join the developers' Discord server and Roblox group, and also follow them on Twitter (see above).

  • Nosniy Games Roblox Group
  • Nosniy Games Discord Server

FAQ

Q: What is the newest code in RIVALS?

The newest RIVALS code is COMMUNITY7 , which can be redeemed for a free Community Wrap.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Dev Comments on Whether a New Weapon Could Be Added to the Game
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Monster Hunter Wilds won't introduce new weapons, focusing on enhancing the existing 14 weapons instead.
  • The charge blade and insect glaive are the "newest" weapons in the game, dating back to Monster Hunter 4.
  • Developers state that making a new 15th weapon would divert resources from improving existing weapons or developing future games.

A developer of Monster Hunter Wilds has confirmed there are no plans to add a new main weapon type, though there are some ideas of what weapon they would like to implement being kicked around. Capcom's Monster Hunter Wilds is the latest title in its illustrious franchise, launching for PS5, PC, and Xbox Series X/S platforms in late February 2025. This title will kick off the sixth generation of Monster Hunter games, with the player exploring the Forbidden Lands, a hostile, unexplored region that holds all sorts of creatures that will need to be hunted.

Monster Hunter Wilds has 14 different weapons to choose from, all of which have their own unique mechanics and playstyles. Many of these weapons are very familiar to fans, as they are all returning from previous games, with classics like the Lance, Sword and Shield, and Gunlance all being back for Wilds . Of the 14 returning weapons, the "newest" of them all would be the charge blade and insect glaive, and even then, those weapons were first introduced back in 2013's Monster Hunter 4 . As such, Monster Hunter Wilds won't be introducing any new weapons to use, to the disappointment of some fans. Monster Hunter Wilds art director Kaname Fujioka and series producer Ryozo Tsujimoto commented on the possibility of new weapons being introduced to the series.

In an interview with Italian site Multiplayer.it (translation courtesy of GamesRadar) Fujioka states the idea of adding a potential new main weapon type for Monster Hunter Wilds was never an abandoned concept, but a lot of ideas have been piling up over the years. The Monster Hunter franchise has technically 18 weapons total, with most of them having appeared in spin-off games or were only in one title.

Monster Hunter Wilds Already has 14 Weapons to Balance With New Mechanics

Monster Hunter Wilds builds upon the approach of Rise and World by refining the 14 existing weapons with new reworks, adding new moves and features. For example, Monster Hunter Wilds has a new counterattack and perfect timing mechanic for almost all weapons. Producer Tsujimoto commented on the current weapon lineup's depth of mechanics, noting that all the weapons have evolved dramatically compared to how they were introduced.

Tsujimoto noted that even the insect glaive and charge blade in Monster Hunter Wilds have changed dramatically compared to their counterparts from Monster Hunter 4 , despite being the "newest," and even classic weapons like the greatsword and longsword are "unrecognizable" from their original versions. Tsujimoto also noted that even if the development team had the resources to make a 15th weapon, the resources used for making it could be better used to invest and improve upon the current weapons or work on the next game. As such, it seems like making a new weapon type for the Monster Hunter franchise is considered a tough act to follow, given how many weapons already exist.
